page.title: 11A DAY ON THE DOLE
page.content: to sign on, then on to the Job Centre.It is a sorry sight to see so many young people perusing the rows of pathetic deadend jobs in the hope that something will turn up. I must call in as the local dockyard recruit labour through these centres. By now it will be around 2p.m. and I may spend an hour at the swimming baths or visit my mother. Next I will return home in time to make the evening meal for the family. After watching the news at 6 O'clock I may spend an hour or two in the garden. By this time with evening drawing in I may watch some television, or play a game with the children, or read a book untill it is time to go to bed.
